abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Python3long; with &AWS;.

section.para: The code examples in this topic show you how to use the &Python3long; with &AWS;.

variablelist.para: The examples are divided into the following categories:

listitem.para: Code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Sample applications that work across multiple &AWS; services.

section.para: Examples

abstract.para: The following code examples show how to implement common scenarios and perform individual service actions by using &Python3; with &AWS; services.

section.para: The following code examples show how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Python3long; with &AWS; services.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Services

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Python3long; with &ACM;.

section.para: The following code examples show you how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Python3long; with &ACM;.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &ACM; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &ACM; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.
The following code example shows how to add tags to &ACM; certificates.
The following code example shows how to delete &ACM; certificates.

The following code example shows how to list tags for &ACM; certificates.
The following code example shows how to remove tags from &ACM; certificates.
The following code example shows how to request validation of &ACM; certificates.

listitem.para: Request a certificate from &ACM;.

Remove certificates.

info.title: Get started running crawlers and jobs
info.titleabbrev: Get started running crawlers and jobs

section.para: The following code example shows how to:

listitem.para: Create and run a crawler that crawls a public &S3long; (&S3;) bucket and generates a metadata database that describes the CSV-formatted data it finds.
List information about databases and tables in your &GLUDCLong;.
Create and run a job that extracts CSV data from the source &S3; bucket, transforms it by removing and renaming fields, and loads JSON-formatted output into another &S3; bucket.
List information about job runs and view some of the transformed data.
Delete all resources created by the demo.

section.para: For more information, see Tutorial: Getting started with &GLU; Studio.

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Python3long; with &STS;.

section.para: The following code examples show you how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Python3long; with &STS;.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &STS; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &STS; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.
The following code example shows how to assume a role with &STS;.
The following code example shows how to get a session token with &STS; and use it to perform a service action that requires an MFA token.
